body:
# Crystalizer

[![CI](https://github.com/j8r/crystalizer/workflows/CI/badge.svg)](https://github.com/j8r/crystalizer/actions?query=workflow%3ACI)
[![Documentation](https://github.com/j8r/crystalizer/workflows/Documentation/badge.svg)](https://j8r.github.io/crystalizer)
[![ISC](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-ISC-blue.svg?style=flat-square)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISC_license)

[De]serialize any Crystal object - out of the box. Supports JSON, YAML and Byte format.

## Features

- [De]serialize anything, "out-of-the-box"
- Advanced serialization with annotations, but **not required**
- Shared annotations for all formats (JSON, YAML...)

Implementation bonus: no monkey patching involved :) (no method pollution on objects)

## Installation

Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

```yaml
dependencies:
  crystalizer:
    github: j8r/crystalizer
```

## Documentation

https://j8r.github.io/crystalizer

## Usage

### Basic

```crystal
require "crystalizer/json"
require "crystalizer/yaml"

struct Point
  getter x : Int32
  @[Crystalizer::Field(key: "Y")]
  getter y : String

  def initialize(@x, @y)
  end
end

point = Point.new 1, "a"

{Crystalizer::YAML, Crystalizer::JSON}.each do |format|
  puts format
  string = format.serialize point
  puts string
  puts format.deserialize string, to: Point
end
```

Result:
```
Crystalizer::YAML
---
x: 1
Y: a
Point(@x=1, @y="a")
Crystalizer::JSON
{
  "x": 1,
  "Y": "a"
}
Point(@x=1, @y="a")
```

### Any

Parsing any type, and converting to JSON/YAML.

```cr
require "crystalizer/json"
require "crystalizer/yaml"

yaml_string = <<-E
one: 1
two: 2
sub:
  ary:
  - one
  - 2
E

yaml_any = Crystalizer::YAML.parse yaml_string
puts yaml_any

json_string = Crystalizer::JSON.serialize yaml_any
puts json_string

json_any = Crystalizer::JSON.parse json_string
puts Crystalizer::YAML.serialize json_any
```

Result:
```yaml
{"one" => 1, "two" => 2, "sub" => {"ary" => ["one", 2]}}
{
  "one": 1,
  "two": 2,
  "sub": {
    "ary": [
      "one",
      2
    ]
  }
}
---
one: 1
two: 2
sub:
  ary:
  - one
  - 2
```

### Note

Annotations are similar to the stdlib's `Serializable`, but all features are not yet fully implemented.

## License

Copyright (c) 2020-2021 Julien Reichardt - ISC License

instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` if both `self` and *other*'s raw object are equal.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if both self and other's raw object are equal.

instance_methods.doc:
Assumes the underlying value is an `Indexable` or a `Hash`, and returns the element
at the given index.

Raises if the underlying value is not an `Indexable` or a `Hash`.
instance_methods.summary: Assumes the underlying value is an Indexable or a Hash, and returns the element at the given index.

instance_methods.doc:
Assumes the underlying value is a `Hash` and returns the element
with the given key.

Raises if the underlying value is not a `Hash`.
instance_methods.summary: Assumes the underlying value is a Hash and returns the element with the given key.

instance_methods.doc:
Assumes the underlying value is an `Indexable` and returns the element
at the given index, or `nil` if out of bounds.

Raises if the underlying value is not an `Indexable`.
instance_methods.summary: Assumes the underlying value is an Indexable and returns the element at the given index, or nil if out of bounds.

instance_methods.doc:
Assumes the underlying value is a `Hash` and returns the element
with the given key, or `nil` if the key is not present.

Raises if the underlying value is not a `Hash`.
instance_methods.summary: Assumes the underlying value is a Hash and returns the element with the given key, or nil if the key is not present.

def.body:
h = to(Hash)
if (typeof(h.values[0])) == Crystalizer::Any
  if key_value = h.find do |__arg0|
    __arg0.first.raw == key
  end
    key_value.last
  end
else
  h[key]?
end

types.name: ByteFormat
types.doc:
Byte format, as implemented in the stdlib: https://crystal-lang.org/api/master/IO/ByteFormat.html.

Important note: bytes representation of dynamic data structures like `Array` and `Hash` have no end delimiter.
On an object, only one of it can be present as the last instance variable, otherwise they will collide with the next ones - having no delimiter to separate them.

Unions are also not supported.
types.summary: Byte format, as implemented in the stdlib: https://crystal-lang.org/api/master/IO/ByteFormat.html.

class_methods.doc: Byte to delimit the end of a `String`.
class_methods.summary: Byte to delimit the end of a String.

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
array = type.new
value_class = typeof(array.first)
yield_until_empty(type) do
  array << (deserialize(value_class))
end
array

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
case byte = @io.read_byte
when 0_u8
  false
when 1_u8
  true
else
  raise(Error.new("Invalid boolean byte different from 0 or 1: #{byte}"))
end

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
hash = type.new
key_class, value_class = typeof(hash.first)
yield_until_empty(type) do
  key = deserialize(key_class)
  value = deserialize(value_class)
  hash[key] = value
end
hash

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
deserializer = Deserializer::NamedTuple.new(type)
deserializer.size.times do
  str = deserialize(String)
  deserializer.set_value(str) do |value_type|
    deserialize(value_type)
  end
end
deserializer.named_tuple

instance_methods.name: deserialize
instance_methods.doc: Deserializes a `String` from reading from the `io`, delimited by a trailing `byte_delimiter`.
instance_methods.summary: Deserializes a String from reading from the #io, delimited by a trailing .byte_delimiter.

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
String.build do |str|
  while (byte = @io.read_byte) && (byte != @byte_delimiter)
    str.write_byte(byte)
  end
end

types.name: Field
types.doc:
Annotations are similar to the stdlib's `Serializable`, but all features are not yet fully implemented.

```
struct Strukt
  @[Crystalizer::Field(ignore: true, key: "Var")]
  @var : Int32
end
```

class_methods.name: deserialize
class_methods.args_string: (string_or_io : String | IO, to type : T.class) : T forall T

class_methods.name: deserialize
class_methods.args_string: (pull : ::JSON::PullParser, to type : ::JSON::Serializable.class | Any.class)

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
hash = type.new
key_class, value_class = typeof(hash.first)
pull.read_object do |key, key_location|
  if parsed_key = deserialize_object_key?(key, key_class)
    hash[parsed_key] = deserialize(pull, value_class)
  else
    raise(::JSON::ParseException.new("Can't convert #{key.inspect} into #{key_class}", *key_location))
  end
end
hash

class_methods.name: deserialize
class_methods.args_string: (pull : ::JSON::PullParser, to type : Array.class | Deque.class | Set.class)

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
array = type.new
value_class = typeof(array.first)
pull.read_array do
  array << (deserialize(pull, value_class))
end
array

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
pull.read_begin_array
tuple = Crystalizer.create_tuple(type) do |value_type|
  deserialize(pull, value_type)
end
pull.read_end_array
tuple

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
deserializer = Deserializer::NamedTuple.new(type)
pull.read_object do |key|
  deserializer.set_value(key) do |value_type|
    deserialize(pull, value_type)
  end
end
deserializer.named_tuple

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
case pull.kind
when .int?
  type.from_value(pull.read_int)
when .string?
  type.parse(pull.read_string)
else
  raise(Error.new("Expecting int or string in JSON for #{type}, not #{pull.kind}"))
end

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
type.new(case pull.kind
when .int?
  value = pull.int_value
  pull.read_next
  value
else
  pull.read_float
end)

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
location = pull.location
value = pull.read_int
begin
  type.new(value)
rescue ex : OverflowError
  raise(::JSON::ParseException.new("Can't read #{type}", *location, ex))
end

class_methods.name: deserialize
class_methods.args_string: (pull : ::JSON::PullParser, to type : T.class) : T forall T

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
{% if T.union_types.size > 1 %}
      deserialize_union(pull, type)
    {% else %}
      deserializer = Deserializer::SelfDescribingObject.new type
      pull.read_begin_object
      while !pull.kind.end_object?
        key = pull.read_object_key
        deserializer.set_ivar key do |variable|
          if variable.nilable || variable.has_default
            pull.read_null_or do
              deserialize pull, variable.type
            end
          else
            deserialize pull, variable.type
          end
        end
      end
      deserializer.object_instance
    {% end %}

class_methods.name: deserialize_object_key?
class_methods.args_string: (number : String, to type : Number::Primitive.class)

class_methods.name: parse
class_methods.doc: Parses a JSON document as a JSON::Any.
class_methods.summary: Parses a JSON document as a JSON::Any.

def.name: serialize
def.body:
String.build do |str|
  serialize(str, object, indent)
end

def.name: serialize
def.body:
builder.object do
  Crystalizer.each_ivar(object) do |key, value|
    builder.field(key) do
      serialize(builder, value)
    end
  end
end

def.name: serialize
def.body:
builder.object do
  named_tuple.each do |key, value|
    builder.field(key) do
      serialize(builder, value)
    end
  end
end

def.name: serialize
def.body:
builder.array do
  array.each do |value|
    serialize(builder, value)
  end
end

def.name: serialize
def.body:
builder.object do
  hash.each do |key, value|
    builder.field(serialize_object_key(key)) do
      serialize(builder, value)
    end
  end
end

def.name: new
def.body:
new(case pull.kind
when .null?
  pull.read_null
when .bool?
  pull.read_bool
when .int?
  pull.read_int
when .float?
  pull.read_float
when .string?
  pull.read_string
when .begin_array?
  ary = Array(Crystalizer::Any).new
  pull.read_array do
    ary << (new(pull))
  end
  ary
when .begin_object?
  hash = Hash(String, Crystalizer::Any).new
  pull.read_object do |key|
    hash[key] = new(pull)
  end
  hash
else
  raise(JSON::Error.new("Unknown pull kind: #{pull.kind}"))
end)

instance_methods.name: raw
instance_methods.doc: Returns the raw underlying value.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the raw underlying value.

types.name: Type
types.aliased: (Array(Crystalizer::Any) | Bool | Float64 | Hash(String, Crystalizer::Any) | Int64 | String | Nil)

types.name: Object
types.doc:
Annotation to add information of how (de)serialize the object.

`fields_order` takes a list of instance variable, used to explicitly define the (de)serialization order.
It matters for some protocols (like binary/bytes-oriented ones).
This option can also be used to only (de)serialize a set of instance variables, and ignore those not.

```
@[Crystalizer::Object(fields_order: %w(var other))]
struct Strukt
  @var : Int32
  @other : String
end
```
types.summary: Annotation to add information of how (de)serialize the object.

types.name: Variable
types.doc: Holds variable metadata with its annotations.

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (type : T.class, annotations : A, nilable : Bool, has_default : Bool)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = Variable(T, A).allocate
_.initialize(type, annotations, nilable, has_default)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

class_methods.name: deserialize
class_methods.args_string: (ctx : ::YAML::ParseContext, node : ::YAML::Nodes::Node, to type : ::YAML::Serializable.class | Any.class)

class_methods.name: deserialize
class_methods.args_string: (string_or_io : String | IO, to type : T.class) : T forall T

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
document = ::YAML::Nodes.parse(string_or_io)
node = document.nodes.first? || (begin
  scalar = ::YAML::Nodes::Scalar.new("")
  scalar.style = ::YAML::ScalarStyle::PLAIN
  scalar
end)
context = ::YAML::ParseContext.new
deserialize(context, node, to: type)

class_methods.name: deserialize
class_methods.args_string: (ctx : ::YAML::ParseContext, node : ::YAML::Nodes::Node, to type : T.class) : T forall T

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
{% if T.union_types.size > 1 %}
      deserialize_union(ctx, node, type)
    {% else %}
      deserializer = Deserializer::SelfDescribingObject.new type
      case node
      when ::YAML::Nodes::Mapping
        ::YAML::Schema::Core.each(node) do |key_node, value_node|
          unless key_node.is_a?(::YAML::Nodes::Scalar)
            key_node.raise "Expected scalar as key for mapping"
          end

          key = key_node.value
          deserializer.set_ivar key do |variable|
            if variable.nilable || variable.has_default
              ::YAML::Schema::Core.parse_null_or(value_node) do
                deserialize ctx, value_node, variable.type
              end
            else
              deserialize ctx, value_node, variable.type
            end
          end
        end
      when ::YAML::Nodes::Scalar
        if node.value.empty? && node.style.plain? && !node.tag
          # We consider an empty scalar as an empty mapping
        else
          node.raise "Expected mapping, not #{node.class}"
        end
      else
        node.raise "Expected mapping, not #{node.class}"
      end
      deserializer.object_instance
    {% end %}

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
ctx.read_alias(node, String) do |obj|
  return obj
end
if node.is_a?(::YAML::Nodes::Scalar)
  value = node.value
  ctx.record_anchor(node, value)
  value
else
  node.raise("Expected String, not #{node.class.name}")
end

class_methods.name: deserialize
class_methods.args_string: (ctx : ::YAML::ParseContext, node : ::YAML::Nodes::Node, to type : Bool.class | Nil.class | Time.class | Slice(UInt8).class)

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
if !node.is_a?(::YAML::Nodes::Scalar)
  node.raise("Expected scalar, not #{node.class}")
end
string = node.value
if value = string.to_i64?
  type.from_value(value)
else
  type.parse(string)
end

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
if node.is_a?(::YAML::Nodes::Mapping)
else
  node.raise("Expected mapping, not #{node.class}")
end
deserializer = Deserializer::NamedTuple.new(type)
::YAML::Schema::Core.each(node) do |key_node, value_node|
  key = String.new(ctx, key_node)
  deserializer.set_value(key) do |value_type|
    deserialize(ctx, value_node, value_type)
  end
end
deserializer.named_tuple

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
if !node.is_a?(::YAML::Nodes::Sequence)
  node.raise("Expected sequence, not #{node.class}")
end
check_tuple_size(node, type)
i = -1
Crystalizer.create_tuple(type) do |value_type|
  i = i + 1
  deserialize(ctx, node.nodes[i], value_type)
end

class_methods.name: deserialize
class_methods.args_string: (ctx : ::YAML::ParseContext, node : ::YAML::Nodes::Node, to type : Array.class | Deque.class | Set.class)

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
ctx.read_alias(node, type) do |obj|
  return obj
end
if !node.is_a?(::YAML::Nodes::Sequence)
  node.raise("Expected sequence, not #{node.class}")
end
array = type.new
value_class = typeof(array.first)
ctx.record_anchor(node, array)
node.each do |value_node|
  array << (deserialize(ctx, value_node, value_class))
end
array

def.name: deserialize
def.body:
ctx.read_alias(node, type) do |obj|
  return obj
end
if !node.is_a?(::YAML::Nodes::Mapping)
  node.raise("Expected mapping, not #{node.class}")
end
hash = type.new
key_class, value_class = typeof(hash.first)
ctx.record_anchor(node, hash)
::YAML::Schema::Core.each(node) do |key, value|
  hash[deserialize(ctx, key, key_class)] = deserialize(ctx, value, value_class)
end
hash

class_methods.name: parse
class_methods.doc: Deserializes a YAML document according to the core schema.
class_methods.summary: Deserializes a YAML document according to the core schema.

def.name: serialize
def.body:
builder.mapping do
  Crystalizer.each_ivar(object) do |key, value|
    serialize(builder, key)
    serialize(builder, value)
  end
end

def.name: serialize
def.body:
builder.mapping do
  named_tuple.each do |key, value|
    serialize(builder, key)
    serialize(builder, value)
  end
end

def.name: serialize
def.body:
builder.sequence(reference: (array.is_a?(Array) ? array : nil)) do
  array.each do |value|
    serialize(builder, value)
  end
end

def.name: serialize
def.body:
builder.mapping(reference: hash) do
  hash.each do |key, value|
    serialize(builder, key)
    serialize(builder, value)
  end
end

def.name: serialize
def.body:
nodes_builder = ::YAML::Nodes::Builder.new
serialize(nodes_builder, object)
::YAML.build(io) do |builder|
  nodes_builder.document.to_yaml(builder)
end

instance_methods.name: raw
instance_methods.doc: Returns the raw underlying value.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the raw underlying value.

types.name: Type
types.aliased: (Array(Crystalizer::Any) | Bool | Float64 | Hash(Crystalizer::Any, Crystalizer::Any) | Int64 | Slice(UInt8) | String | Time | Nil)
